channel.title: Need help on reading filesnames from a text files
channel.description:
hi im geting fed up with uploading a new webclient every times i add a extra mid
just wondering if theres a way i can make it read a online text file and line by line and read the filesnames ive looked but i cant find

item.title: Need help on reading filesnames from a text files

item.description:

use tokens, though I canâ€™t help you.
Or transform the file contents into a string, and split it with spaces.

item.title: Need help on reading filesnames from a text files
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The code I gave you will read each line off a page line by line, so you should be able to figure out what to do with it from there, use string functions and maybe even .split() to find exactly what you want.

item.source: Need help on reading filesnames from a text files

item.title: Need help on reading filesnames from a text files
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

public static void getNews() { try { URL newsUrl = new URL("http://www.moparisthebest.com/news/news.php"); URLConnection newsConnect = newsUrl.openConnection(); newsConnect.setRequestProperty("User-Agent", "Mozilla"); newsConnect.connect(); BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(newsConnect.getInputStream())); String buffer; while ((buffer = reader.readLine()) != null) { System.out.println(buffer); } } catch (Exception e) { log("Error downloading news"); } }

That should do it, ripped from moparscape.

Read full topic
